attributes.action: Hold A Second EU referendum- Now the facts are apparent
attributes.additional_details:
Facts
-Scotland, Northern Ireland and Gibraltar voted to remain. It was not known that leaving the EU would result in a break up of the UK, it is now likely.
-Young voters overwhelmingly wish to remain part of the EU, older voters should decide if this makes them feel differently.
-There are immediate and likely ongoing adverse economic impacts.  
-There has been unprecedented political instability following the result.
-Vote Leave leadership has been extremely poor following the decision.
attributes.background:
All,
Since the EU In/Out vote on 23/06/16 the following unknowns have now become known. Due to these facts I would petition the UK needs to have a re-vote in order to make a more informed decision regards EU membership.
